Uses of Interface
org.hs.generator.GStatement

Packages that use GStatement
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. 
org.hs.generator This Java code generating package is designed for both static and dynamic (especially interactive) clients. 
 

Uses of GStatement in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
 

Classes in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar that implement GStatement
 class Paragraph
           
 class Sentence
          Sentence is a transparent wrapper for GStatement, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.

Classes in org.hs.generator that implement GStatement
 class GBinary
          GBinary represents an assortment of binary (i.e., two-sided) expressions which includes:
 class GBlock
          A GBlock represents {a block of code in braces}, separate from those blocks that are intrinsically attached to a loop or switch construct.
 class GBreak
          This class represents a break statement in the context of a conditional loop or switch statement.
 class GClassInit
          A class initializer block, which may be static.
 class GCode
          This class is kind of a cluge; it allows a block of text to be included in the GConstruct tree as a statement of Java code.
 class GContinue
          A continue statement in the context of a conditional loop.
 class GFor
          This class represents a for loop such as:
 class GIf
          An if statement, comprised of the expected condition expression, thenClause and elseClause.
 class GLoop
          An abstract base class for conditional loops.
 class GMethodCall
          A method call expression or statement.
 class GNew
          An constructor invocation through the keyword 'new', by classname and optionally including a subclass definition (in the case of an anonymous instance creation).
 class GReturn
          A return statement.
 class GStepwise
          A stepwise operator, one of:
 class GSwitch
          A switch statement, using GSwitchLabelGroup for case labels.
 class GSynchronized
          A synchronized statement.
 class GThrow
          A throw statement.
 class GTry
          A try/catch/finally statement.
 class GVariable
          This chameleonic class can represent a local variable, a class field, a parameter, or one of the keywords this, super, class, length.
 class GVariableList
          A list of GVariables all declared in a single statement.
 class GWhile
          A while or do loop.
